title: Accor plans to open 30 new hotels in India in 3-5 years
description: French hospitality major Accor is planning to open 30 new properties in India over the next three to five years. The company aims to tap into the country's potential and cater to different customer segments by introducing more brands. The properties will be developed by local partners and run by Accor under its existing nine brands in India. The hospitality chain also plans to target tier II and III cities, which have seen increased demand and growth of room rates following the Covid pandemic. Accor currently has 61 hotels in India with about 11,500 operating rooms.
